sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Iran's president has accused Israel and the US of involvement in a deadly bomb attack that killed 95 people and warned that those responsible will pay a high price. Israel says it's on high alert for an escalation with Hezbollah after one of Hamas's top leaders was killed in a strike in Beirut. With the European elections only six months away, June could be a turning point for far-right forces in the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Iran's president has warned those responsible for a deadly bomb attack that they will pay a high price.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At least 95 people died and over 200 were injured at a commemoration for a prominent Iranian general killed by the US in 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: No one has claimed responsibility for what appears to be the bloodiest militant attack to target Iran since its 1979 Islamic revolution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While President Raisi accused Israel and the US of involvement, Iran has multiple foes who could be behind the assault, including exile groups, militant organizations and state actors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Satellite images showed large crowds of people on Wednesday gathered to mark the fourth anniversary of the killing of General Qasem Soleimani, the head of the Revolutionary Guards' elite Quds Force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Two explosions occurred near his gravesite as hundreds of people gathered for the event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The U.S. State Department has dismissed accusations of involvement as ridiculous.

sentences.sentence: The United States was not involved in any way, and any suggestion to the contrary is ridiculous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And number two, we have no reason to believe that Israel was involved in this explosion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Wednesday's attack comes amid heightened tensions in the region after the deputy leader of the Iran-backed Palestinian group Hamas was killed in an apparent Israeli drone strike in Lebanon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The authorities have declared Thursday as a national day of mourning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Israel says it carried out strikes on Lebanese territory against infrastructure linked to Hezbollah. Israel's army has said it's on high alert for an escalation with a militant group after a top Hamas leader was killed in a strike in Beirut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: the strike in Beirut. The death of Salah al-Aruri, the most senior Hamas member killed since the conflict in Gaza erupted nearly three months ago, has been blamed on Israel, despite no claim of responsibility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Twenty-four hours after the strike, Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah said that Israel should expect a response and punishment and warned that if the enemy thinks of waging a war on Lebanon, it will come at a very high cost.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile Israeli troops fighting in Gaza Strip were seen regrouping and restocking in southern Israel as heavy fighting raged in central and southern Gaza on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Israel's air, ground and sea offensive in Gaza has killed more than 22,000 people, according to Palestinian authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Intensive battles in and around Khan Yunis in the south of Gaza have been continuing for several days. Israel says an IDF fighter jet struck an Islamic Jihad weapons production complex. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A major shift is taking place in Europe. According to an analyst, the European elections in June might be a turning point for far-right forces in the EU. Those parties are already far from being on the fringes of the political spectrum, taking on their own government roles or collaborating alongside mainstream right-wing parties. Ahead of June's European elections, an analyst from European Elects predicts that the far-right's result could be summed up as the second political force in the European Parliament.

sentences.sentence: According to our data, as of December 2023, there's been the highest result of the identity and democracy group of Marine Le Pen and Matteo Salvini in three years, with the group scoring a 12% result. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Despite the general electoral increase of the extreme right, it will be difficult for far-right parties to unite and form a common political group, mostly because of the extreme right, it will be difficult for far-right parties to unite and form a common political group, mostly because of the ideological differences between them.

Not only are the parties divided, but so are the European member states. As the analyst reminds us, the vote for the European elections goes through the national perspective, which often differs greatly between the member states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Europe's longest reigning living monarch, Queen Margaretha II of Denmark, took her last official golden carriage ride through Copenhagen on Thursday, ahead of her abdication set for the 14th of January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Thousands braved the freezing temperatures, strong wind, snow and sleet to catch a glimpse of the Queen in what's set to be her last public appearance as monarch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Her abdication will mark the end of her 52-year reign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The 83-year-old will hand the throne to her eldest son, Crown Prince Frederick.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A judge in a court in Las Vegas has been brutally attacked by a defendant she was sentencing

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: for a violent crime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As Judge Mary Kay Holthus read out her ruling, 30-year-old Diogra Dallone Redden charged from the courtroom floor and jumped on top of her.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Court officials and lawyers intervened to restrain him but could not prevent Redden from landing several blows on the shocked victim.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Holthus sustained slight injuries but did not require hospital treatment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Redden is now facing fresh assault charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Staff at London Zoo have been busy counting the thousands of animals as part of its annual

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: census.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The zoo is home to more than 300 different species, great and small, from giant tortoises to millipedes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: All the data goes to a database that's then shared with other zoos across the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Crucially it supports breeding programmes to ensure sustainable long-term populations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: London Zoo looks after many endangered animals, including some species which are extinct in the wild.
